title: New social projects for Vancouver
name: New social projects for Vancouver
description:
A Map by Vancouverpapers

The city of Vancouver and the province of B.C. will build 1,200 social housing units on city-owned land over the next four years. Here are the details.

properties.name: 1050 Expo Blvd.
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1050 Expo Blvd., Vancouver, B.C.Current condition: Irregular site in Concorde Pacific Place is vacant land Site potential: Up to 100 studio units Target population: Singles living in shelters and downtown hotels, up to half with mental illness or addictions

properties.name: 1134 Burrard St.
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1134 Burrard St., Vancouver, B.C.1134 Burrard St. (at Helmcken) Current condition: One-storey building is occupied by the Directions youth centre, which has a lease to June 2010 Site potential: Up to 100 studio units and a youth services hub on the first and possibly second floor Target population: One third to one half of the units could be occupied by youth, referred and supported by youth services

properties.name: 1233-1251 Howe St.
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1233-1251 Howe St., Vancouver, B.C.Current condition: One building with two tenants, leased to 2008 and 2011; longer lease can be bought out Site potential: Up to 100 studio units Target population: Singles living in shelters and downtown hotels, up to half with mental illness or addictions

properties.name: 1308 Seymour
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1308 Seymour, Vancouver, B.C.Current condition: Three lots are vacant, one occupied by month-to-month tenants Site potential: Up to 100 studio units Target population: Priority for singles living in shelters and hotels in Downtown South

properties.name: 1607-1615 West 7 Ave.
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1607-1615 West 7 Ave., Vancouver, B.C.1607-1615 West 7 Ave. (at Fir) Current condition: Three lots contain a single one-storey building, tenant is renting Site potential: About 70 studio living units could be created with a mental health drop-in centre Target population: Talks underway with Motivation Power and Achievement Society to locate in new building with one third to one half of the units for people with a mental illness

properties.name: 1721-1723 Main St.
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers1721-1723 Main St., Vancouver, B.C.Current condition: Site is occupied by one-storey industrial buildings, last tenancy expires June 2009 Site potential: Up to 80 studio units with ground-level retail on the Main St. Target population: Priority for singles living in shelters and hotels in Mt. Pleasant and the Downtown Eastside

properties.name: 215-225 West 2 Ave.
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers215-225 West 2 Ave., Vancouver, B.C.Three lots; rezoning required Site potential: Up to 100 studio units with ground-level retail on West 2 Ave. Target population: Priority for singles living in shelters and hotels in Mt. Pleasant and the Downtown Eastside, up to half with mental illness or addictions

properties.name: 3588-3596 West 16 Ave.
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers3588-3596 West 16 Ave., Vancouver, B.C.3588-3596 West 16 Ave. (at Dunbar) Current condition: Commercial building has four tenants with month-to-month tenancy Site potential: Retail development on Dunbar St. with 50 studio units Target population: One third to one half of the units could be occupied by people with mental illness, all units targeted to core-need singles living in Dunbar, Point Grey and Kitsilano

properties.name: 505 Abbott Street
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers505 Abbott St., Vancouver, B.C.Current condition: The former International Village presentation centre is vacant Site potential: Up to 120 units could be built under current zoning with retail at street level Target population: Priority housing for Downtown Eastside residents of rooming houses and shelters, one third of the units will be targeted for people with addiction and mental health issues

properties.name: 590 Alexander St.
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers590 Alexander St., Vancouver, B.C.Current condition: Occupied by 76-unit social housing complex Marie Gomez Place, to be demolished Site potential: Up to 100 units with meals provided from a common kitchen and dining area Target population: Low-barrier housing for people with mental illness and/or addictions

properties.name: 606 Powell St.
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers606 Powell St., Vancouver, B.C.Current condition: Site of the former Drake Hotel, to be demolished Site potential: Up to 100 studio units with commercial space on the ground floor Target population: Singles living in shelters and downtown hotels, up to half with mental illness or addictions

properties.name: 675-691 East Broadway
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers675-691 East Broadway, Vancouver, B.C.Current condition: Building has four tenants, including the Pacific Community Resource Society, which has a lease to 2014 Site potential: A mix of market and social housing up to 100 units could be built with ground floor commercial or retail space and a youth services hub Target population: Rezoning could allow a high-density tower to be built with up to half the units occcupied by youth if the service hub is part of the project

properties.name: Title or search term
properties.description: Posted by Vancouverpapers505 Abbott St., Vancouver, B.C.
